Reviews.Title: “Very good service”
Reviews.Author: Richard B
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is OK, nothing extra. The internet service is VERY slow...almost and probably not high speed. The staff is, however, everything but standard. The desk clerk was very helpful and eager to help and/or service us. Cleanliness is OK, but there is that smell you can detect in mid-class hotels and suites. But, other than that, it was a good bang for our buck.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Yohsuke1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for its convenient location. Walking distance to old town and there are several subway stations around the hotel. There is also bus stop for the airport just in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and excellent front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: FamilyKP
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Days Inn centreville in Montreal. Hotel is well located and within walking distance of the metro. Hotel is pleasant, beds are very comfortable, air conditioning works well, halls are quiet at night unlike some other hotels in montreal. DÃ©cor in the rooms is a bit dated â€“ a change of carpets and removing the aging wall paper will do it some good. Most importantly I was impressed with the front desk staff. A shout out to Simon Pak who patiently mapped out the streets for me every day, so that I could travel and see the sites. I either walked or took the metro and saw the Notre Dame basilica, the Cathedral Marie Renee, St Josephs oratory, walked the underground, walked along St Catherineâ€™s street both east and west of St Laurent, went to Place Jacque Cartier, museum marguerite bourgeois, marche bonsecours and on the streets of old montreal. I would stay at the Days Inn centreville again, not for the rooms but for the service that I received.

Reviews.Title: “A bit dated, but very well priced.”
Reviews.Author: cyrixmeister
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night and had a room on the 8th floor. Valet parking was very efficient and had no issues whatsoever. The carpets in the hallway looked worn out and perhaps needs to be cleaned up. On the other hand, the room was clean with no major issues to report. Though the comforter was a bit short for my tastes, the bed and pillows were reasonably comfortable. The hotel seems to attract a younger clientele (ie. under 30 years old) during the weekend, though I was not disturbed by any rowdiness at all (the hotel did have very strict ground rules in this regard and is located next door to a community police station). Location-wise, this hotel is near Quartier Latin (5-10 minute walk from the hotel). As other reviewers wrote, the nearest Metro stations are a five-minute walk from the hotel. For the price paid, the hotel is a pretty good bargain, especially if you don't plan to dwell in the hotel all day.

Reviews.Title: “good location? depends what your looking for...”
Reviews.Author: j s
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel in downtown and walking distance to downtown activities this hotel could be perfect for you. Parking is extra 23 dolars per day as it's case for most of the downtown hotels. However if you've never been to Montreal before, "good location" could be misleading because especially at night downtown area could be pretty dangerous to hang out. I bought from hotwire and hotel room was pretty nice for the price I've paid. Overall I definitely recommend this hotel if you're looking to stay in downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Value hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: cbc1974
Reviews.Content: [Disclaimer... booked this hotel through a blind booking on Expedia.ca] Pretty good location wise... five minutes from the Champ de Mars Metro station, five minutes from China and old Montreal as well. Service is friendly and trouble free... Downside is that the hotel is a bit dated. The condition of the facilities are a bit worn out. Also remember to bring your own toothbrush, toothpaste and comb. Towels, soap and shampoo are provided, but it's the other stuff that was lacking. Bed was a bit lumpy, but you shouldn't expect one of those high end beds in a place like this.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel!”
Reviews.Author: prozerran
Reviews.Content: 2nights - Booked a Superior King room but got upgraded to Queen Mini Suite. Pros - Location: Airport shuttle 747 stopped right outside hotel and return shuttle on same side of road. $8 one way or $16 for 3 day pass also valid for metro and airport shuttle. 5-7min walk to metro train station. Close to Latin Quarter restaurants on Rue-St Denis east side of Rue St Catherine. - Tea/Coffee/Bar fridge in room. - Staff helpful. There is a business centre on level 2 with one working computer very slow though. No printer. Staff will help with printing if you email them. - Very good value of money hotel. - American Breakfast about $10 + taxes Cons - Very minor flaw. If it is snowing can be a little cold to walk 5-7mins to train station. Other hotels around central train station have underground passages connecting them to each other. Did not affect us at all with slight snow. - Furnishing could do with an upgrade. Great hotel. Good location and value

Reviews.Title: “basic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: DGA69
Reviews.Content: again, i booked my hotel through travelocity & was pleasantly surprised by the quality & location of this hotel. a large clean modern room with free wifi. loved having a mini fridge as well! :)

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Deediva81
Reviews.Content: Ok for the night after escaping from another place that was bed bug infested. The staff were helpful and changed my sheets when requested. It wasnt the cleanest but liked the wifi and some staff were good to deal with!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, value for money”
Reviews.Author: sygnin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during our trip to Montreal. I booked the hotel through the hotel's website. I was looking for a comfortable and affordable hotel that was within walking distance of Old Montreal, and this place seemed to have more favorable reviews compared to the other options in the price range. I booked a Queen suite through the hotel's website. Due to some technical error, the online system gave me a confirmation for a King suite instead. I called up the hotel and the lady immediately helped me with the booking. She offered me a Queen executive room at the price I had originally seen on the website and I accepted that (I think there is little difference between the 'mini-suite' and the executive room apart from the sliding bedroom door in the mini suite). The hotel was a short cab red from the train station (about $10), and is also easily accessible via the Metro and a short walk. The room itself was about what I expected - a clean, neat business type hotel. I was pleasantly surprised to find that the room was larger than I expected. We didn't have much of a view from our window since it faced the opposite building, but that didn't bother us. The room is heated and cooled by a built-in unit that has a thermostat dial that allows you to control the temperature. In addition to the bed, the room had a large sitting area with a full sofa and coffee table, as well as a desk and a chair. The bathroom had basic amenities - bar soap, shampoo, shower cap and a hairdryer. There was a little card saying something about asking for more amenities at the front desk if you needed them but we did not need to use the service. The hotel does have a little resto-bar in the lobby that offers room service. The food is not too bad and reasonably priced for hotel food. There are however other places to grab a bite if you don't mind a short walk from the hotel. All in all, I found the hotel to be great value for money. It was not posh or romantic, but it was clean and comfortable, easily accessible and affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Low cost, High Quality for Low $”
Reviews.Author: wacotx46
Reviews.Content: This Days Inn is right next to Old Montreal. It is convenient to port, shopping, Chinatown, Latin Quarter, and many sights. We were pleasantly surprised by the corner suite we got with windows looking out over city. There were plenty of amenities, a very comfortable bed, 2 flat screen TV's, and yet was very reasonably priced! They were booked up so we were glad to have made reservation early. There is a small cafe attached with excellent food at moderate prices. Service in cafe was small but packed with people. The ice and cola machines are only on certain floors. The lobby has nice decor and daily newspapers for free. It has several meeting rooms. It's much larger than it appears from outside. There is a bus stop right outside, and taxis are available very quickly. The front desk manager provided me some toiletries that I had forgotten at no charge. You can also schedule a city tour from front desk. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “only there to sleep”
Reviews.Author: rainbowjudi
Reviews.Content: This hotel badly needs an overhaul...of course then the price would escalate! Location is excellent, coffee shop on main floor great for breakfasts. Staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Lee L
Reviews.Content: Standard room with two double beds, lots of space. It's not bad but for sure, it's not the best. Location: two blocks from Chinatown, very close to St. Catherine street (where you can shop, eat and party). From the hotel to the shopping area on St. Catherine street is about 10 minutes walk. It's a good walk. I shopped at Simons and love the store.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place For The Price”
Reviews.Author: DivineMarquis
Reviews.Content: Great Location. Near 2 Metro stations, close to Old Montreal, the rooms are clean and the service is good. Didn;t like the valet parking. They hold on to your keys and it costs 20 per day to park. There are cheaper places to park right down the street.

Reviews.Title: “superb location”
Reviews.Author: sheric
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 2 nights whilst sightseeing in montreal.We could not have picked a better hotel.It was located just a few minutes walk from most attractions.plenty of bars and restaurants withinn the immediate vicinity. The rooms were spacious and pleasant.Car parking was provided at the hotel and whenever you wanted your car you simply rang down to reception and the car would be waiting for you. breakfast was not included in the price but we ate in the hotel both mornings,it proved to be a good choice.good food and good price in comfortable surroundings.We also had a drink in the bar 1 night,again this was pleasant and reasonable. The rooms were not cheap (about Â£110 a night) but well worth it

Reviews.Title: “Days Inn Montreal”
Reviews.Author: HHH747
Reviews.Content: Good access to the airporter bust #747 direct to Montreal airport. No need to pay for taxi or shuttle. Really cheap and efficient transit and subway to get around. Buy the 3 day pass for only $16.00 and travel all over Montreal.QC. Caution do not go toLaurier restaurant owned by Chef Gordon Ramsay....Over rated, Overpriced, had better chicken and Poutine at COSTCO! The wait is not worth it..A lot of HYPE!! Very disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “We were very pleased.”
Reviews.Author: mostlylol
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean, updated and recently renovated, (well deserving a 3-star hotel rating) and amenities above the norm ie china coffee mugs and plastic cups not styrofoam. The cafe/bar in the hotel was excellent and a pleasant surprise for its small size. Staff very friendly and helpful. Also one of the quickest elevators, both arrival time and travel time, we've ever encountered in any hotel. The only complaint is that a sign on the street denoting valet parking would have been appreciated and prevented a several times around the block drive trying to figure out where to park.

Reviews.Title: “good value and location”
Reviews.Author: Adnanistheman
Reviews.Content: overall the location is great. 10-15mins to anywhere you want to be in downtown by walking. Parking is valet and its $20. The hotel is clean and decent enough. The bathrooms could use some definite updating and a real good scrubbing. There were 3 of us staying and they only gave us 1 towel, and when I asked for extra towels they were dirty. The staff were okay, not overly friendly but nice enough. I say if you can get a good rate (under 100) then its a real good deal.

Reviews.Title: “fair”
Reviews.Author: Backpackerpaddy
Reviews.Content: it was clean, tidy, nice food, not really got valule for money, 20$ extra to have your car parked at the hotel safely. then on the card for your car it says no liability for damage to car, why am i paying some hotel to park my car and i still have no peace of mind????

Reviews.Title: “Great location, adequate, and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: dreamyr227
Reviews.Content: I booked a two-night stay through Travelocity for $98/night with my best friend. We didn't have high expectations since we chose the hotel for its location and only planned on using the room for showering and sleeping. The carpeting in the corridors and elevators were worn, old, dirty, and dusty. However, we were pleasantly surprised with our room. The bathroom was spacious, there was plenty of counter space, and everything was clean. The window shades and the AC/heating unit were easy to use. The beds were very comfortable. The best part was the location. This hotel is right smack in the middle of everything: the Latin Quarter is to the north, Chinatown is right next door, Old Montreal is south, and the shopping malls are to the west. Everything was so close by we never had to use the metro. If you do plan on using the metro, there are two stations very close by.

Reviews.Title: “Staff were pushy about checkout.”
Reviews.Author: Buchans79
Reviews.Content: Actually my stay was from before Sept 2010. Days inn was ok price for location, but the staff were very inflexible about checkout times. Most places allow for an extension of at least an hour, this was not the case here. Staff were incourtious on this subject.

Reviews.Title: “convenient to Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: thelild
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just fine for an overnight or couple night's stay. For Montreal, the price is right and the location is perfect for spending time in Old Montreal and the waterfront. When the weather is nice, it's really not a bad walk to the Place des Arts area as well. Maybe about 15-20 minutes. The person at the reception desk was pleasant and helpful. There is free wi-fi and a small cafe by the lobby. I would say the bathrooms could use some updating, and overall the rooms are clean, but definitely "no frills. The bed was quite comfortable though and it was quiet enough for sleeping. .Valet parking is available in a small outdoor lot behind the hotel for $20.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel downtown Montreal close to Old Montreal, Chinatown, the Village and subways”
Reviews.Author: elo68
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Montreal at the main train station downtown. We choose to walk to the hotel, that was only 1km far. We found the place really easily, and discovered that several buses stop in front of the hotel (150, express 747..) ! We arrived before noon, and surprisingly the room was available (usually they have the room available at 3pm). We could drop of our luggage, and be ready for the exciting discovery of Montreal. The bathroom was huge, with a nice bathtub (multiple shower jets)... The actual sleeping place was separated in two "rooms", one with a couch, a TV and a closet with mirror-doors, coffee machine and iron device ; while the second had a desk, the bed and a second tv. We had a breakfast included (coffee and a croissant or bagel, you choose), but you can also choose from the large menu choice what you feel like, at your cost. The restaurant of the hotel offers you breakfast to dinner, and even has a patio (along the Blvd RÃ©nÃ©-LÃ©vÃªque) where you could have a drink. We had a nice view towards old Montreal and without one building, would have been able to watch the last Fireworks of the Feux de Loto QuÃ©bec... The cleaning of your room is efficient, people are firendly, and you are pleased to leave your room at Noon. What is really amazing is that in 10 min you could be in Old Montreal (Hotel de Ville, Bonsecourt Market...), in Chinatown, in the Village... You can take the subway on the orange line, on the green line (both are close to the hotel) or even go to Berry UQAM (main metro connection station). We will definetively stay again in this hotel next time we go to Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hotelmaster101
Reviews.Content: This hotel has good wifi but not high speed Small rooms but with new furniture No view Bad service Go to days inn if your disparate because there's better hotel in downtown Overall it's a good hotel with a good price but it's nothing special

Reviews.Title: “Bistro Allegro was good!”
Reviews.Author: speedjacer
Reviews.Content: Can't say anything about the hotel (we were staying somewhere else) but just wanted to say that the restaurant, Bistro Allegro, was very nice. We had breakfast there on a Saturday - nothing special, but it was clean and bright, not too busy, had good food (I especially enjoyed my crepes!), and excellent staff!

Reviews.Title: “Meh, ok hotel for a fair price, that's about it...”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler58
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here mid week in July when we came to Montreal to watch L'International des Feux Loto-Quebec. We were only staying one night and just wanted a reasonably priced, clean, close to downtown hotel. We paid $95 member rate (Costco - who knew!), and a reasonably priced clean close to downtown hotel is exactly what we got. Very much a no frills hotel but decent for a sleep and shower and get on with your day (bed was quite comfortable). Front desk was EXTREMELY coureous and friendly upon check in and check out. Mandatory valet parking for $20 per night (no other option), however service was very quick, we forgot to call ahead before coming down from our room but waited no more than 3 minutes! One thing I will point out that I was very pleasantly surprised is the rooms are VERY quiet! We were directly beside the elevator, and I was prepared to go back to the front desk and ask to be moved - expecting to hear the elevator running constantly. We did not hear a sound, nor did we from the hallway. I couldn't believe it! Not sure if we would make a point to return, but I think I would consider it an option in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms an poor services for the prices they request”
Reviews.Author: DianaLabes
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in early July 2011. I booked a room qvadruple (for 4 people) for a big rate .When we arrived we found that the room was very small. it was a room for 2 persons, a twin room in fact with was very small space between the two beds. We've received only two towels in the room, although the we've booked the room for 4 persons . Only after we've called the reception they've brought the other towels. The bathroom was clean, but not as we expect. The next day, after they've clean the room we found again two towels instead of 4. Also, the staff was very grumpy at breakfast. They have only valet parking at 20 CAD/ night. I would not go again to that hotel that after my parrying is not a good quality - price.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the right price”
Reviews.Author: centralNFLD
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a 4-night Easter getaway, mainly to see the Terracotta Warriors exhibit at the Fine Arts Museum. The hotel looks fairly modern from the outside, but the rooms are tired...downright exhausted. However, they are clean, and roomy, with coffeemaker, minifridge, and wifi. The desk staff was friendly, and let me check in early. The location is ok, but not great: it's 4-5 blocks to Old Montreal, or St. Catherine St., to reach restaurants/stores/attractions. The hotel is on a main artery, good for airport connections, but otherwise kind of dead.

Reviews.Title: “Near Chinatown and station, good staff, tasty breakfast but limited lifts!”
Reviews.Author: dimsum888
Reviews.Content: Got this off Expedia and so no Wyndham Rewards alas! The hotel is located in "downtown" (or Centreville in French) but is really near to the Chinatown of Montreal which is within walking distance - you can pop down to the many eateries there. Walk further down to find the IGA supermarket which reception mentioned to us for your drinks and snacks and other groceries that you might need. Walk the other way and you will get to the metro/bus station which is the terminus for the Airport 747 express bus - you can get a 3 day metro card which includes this service so you can plan it into your itinerary, sadly the attendants are VERY unhelpful here in the city and we felt very unwelcomed. Thankfully a passer by helped us at the machine - you can only get these tickets with cash from these machines. The hotel has 2 lifts to take you to the guest rooms and these can get busy with a queue, there were a group of children during our stay and we had to wait. Ice machines are in the corridor too, this can get a bit noisy but I usually sleep through thanks to ear plugs. Wifi was a bit hit and miss in the room we had, I was picking up the next door Holiday Inn's signal (though this also needed a key). TV reception was also similarly very poor in my room and was fed back to reception on the feedback form. Overall a reasonable place to stay - close by to certain transport links but not quite in the centre of the city.

Reviews.Title: “A last minute bargain”
Reviews.Author: TravelM0nkey
Reviews.Content: My first piece of advice - don't leave it to the last minute (like, the same day) to book a hotel in Montreal at the weekend, I was lucky to find anywhere to stay at all! I stayed here on a saturday and sunday night, and I was so relieved to get a hotel for $100 a night last minute, Days Inn was a lifesaver! I didn't have high expectations, but I had checked tripadvisor reviews on the train online when I was booking and thought it should be ok. It was true - this hotel is perfectly fine for a budget place, and is amazingly well located in downtown Montreal. Pros - Fantastic location. The room was enormous and the bed was pretty comfy (if a little on the soft side). Bathroom was spacious and fine too. Free wifi internet quality was good enough for skype video, a big plus. Staff were pleasant. Considering location I think I was lucky to have a pretty quiet room. Last minute availability! Pleasant decor. No bed bugs and high standard of cleanliness. Cons - air conditioning was noisy (though was much better when on a low setting). There is a bit of street noise, the worst being the police sirens, I came to the conclusion there is a police station around the corner due to all the parked police cars in the next street (either that or the neighborhood is a lot more dodgy than I thought!). The worst noise came from late saturday night revellers returning to their rooms though, there is really no soundproofing on the doors and you hear everyone who walks past. Scratchy carpet - but then, it is budget-level so really the decor is more than fine for the price.

Reviews.Title: “We borrowed sofa pillows from a friend.”
Reviews.Author: Redgardener
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean hotel, decent bed, pillows were useless. The pillows were so full and high that they were only good for sitting upright to read or watch television. There's no way anyone could sleep with their necks at a right angle to their bodies. We called the front desk for flatter pillows and were told that all of the pillows in the whole hotel were exactly the same. The first night, we made pillows by rolling up our jackets and wrapping them in a pillow case. The next night, we borrowed end pillows from our friend's sofa so we could have something comfortable to sleep on. I don't think we'll bother staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel except for old TV”
Reviews.Author: Singhjee
Reviews.Content: Good location, close to Saint Catherine Road ( main shopping road) and Chinatown. Liked almost everything, including the breakfast, except the old TV, which had a few channels in English and French. Would happily return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable & well-priced”
Reviews.Author: Crimsonsketch
Reviews.Content: During a trip to Ottawa, my husband and I spent a night in Montreal, and decided to stay here as it was centrally located and a good price. The room was more comfortable than we expected. The decor was a little dated, but the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was large with lots of counter space. Best sleep we had over the whole week. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrrussellcoight
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, check-in was very quick and the staff on the front desk offered us advice on areas to visit and supplied us with city maps. The hotel is within walking distance to downtown and is also very close to Chinatown which was a great place to venture out for dinner. The only downside to the hotel for some people would be that the location is a little isolated and walking back after an evening out didn't feel overly safe. Rooms were a good size and modern and overall a comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, but concern about how close rooms are together”
Reviews.Author: Timothy_Adams
Reviews.Content: I'll cut to the chase: the hotel and the room were great, but I'm concerned enough about a factor to be described later that I'm not entirely sure I'd return to this hotel ... even though this factor wasn't an issue during my visit. First, the positives: Lovely room. I wanted a room with a safe, which is why I wound up in a suite -- ordinarily pricier than the kind of room a cheapskate like me would select, but I think they cut me a discount because of the time of year of my visit. (Not much competition for hotel rooms in Montreal in February.) Bug free. Passed my flashlight inspection with flying colors. Quiet; I slept well. Great heater, an important factor in Montreal in February. The room safe broke (!!) on the first day, but they fixed it within a mere four hours, which I regard as excellent service by any standard. The in-the-room fridge worked, and a nice IGA market is only four blocks away. Easy walking distance to the Champ de Mars metro station, even in winter. Close to old Montreal, a plus for tourists. Plush lobby. The room didn't include breakfast; instead, they offered a breakfast for $7.50 a throw (in advance) at the adjacent restaurant. I used the IGA and fridge instead, to save money. (Did I mention I'm a cheapskate?) No laundromat, so I had to shlep a load to a buanderie ways out near the Snowdon station, although I probably could have found one closer by. No gym. The room safe wasn't big enough for a laptop. The wifi works. No mattress encasements, which I think all hotel beds should have these days. So what concerns me, if everything was so pretty, and I slept well, and staff were excellent? Just this: if you step off the elevator and look down the hall for your room, you'll notice that the hall is narrow and that all the doors to the rooms are mighty close together. Close enough together to make me worry about how well I'd sleep with partygoing twenty somethings staying nearby on the same floor. That's the bottom line for me. I'm a business traveler. I want to work and sleep. I was able to do both at Days Inn Montreal this February, but all those rooms smushed together in such a close space worries me a bit. More space between rooms gives me protection if a couple of young loadies happen to rent a nearby room. I worry that I wouldn't have that protection at this Days Inn. Maybe it's not fair to site a concern that wasn't even an issue during my stay. Still: if I return to Montreal but don't stay here, that would be the reason why.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: whileitravel
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel b/c the price and location. It is a mere 10 minute walk from the Via Rail Station. On arrival check-in was quick and efficient with a smile. Maps of the city were offered as was any questions I had. The room was more than adequate. Antiquated TV was a small downfall, but it did offer lots of channels. Free wifi was a big plus. I did have to use their business centre and fax machine and was quite pleased. The bed was quite comfortable, but the pillows are too big, leaving me with a crimp in my neck every morning upon waking. The room has a desk which came in handy. Location is close to the Latin Quarter and Centreville with plenty of coffee shops, shopping centres and restaurants nearby. Check-out was quick with no surprises. For the price you can't go wrong with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Decently priced hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ryanchangy
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and in good condition. We had a deluxe queen suite. It was a decent size. Staff was friendly and helpful. The only complaint was they never came to clean the room and weren't going to until we asked. We were there over new years so there were lots of teenagers staying at the hotel. If you're looking for a decently priced hotel with the basics in a great location then this is a safe choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service - excellent restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: Judith8400
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to stay - at a few steps from Chinatown and downtown Montreal. I was pleasantly surprised by the restaurant where the offerings seem quite good. Because of a tight schedule I could only catch a quick breakfast...but the lunch menu looked excellent and very reasonably priced too. Will visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, very good hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: erragland
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights for a business conference. The staff were consistently friendly and helpful, and gave some of the best service I have ever seen. The rooms are clean and well-appointed. For the price, you could not do better in downtown Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, Average Location, But very good value”
Reviews.Author: pinnertraveller1986
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing special. I would describe it as a standard 3 star hotel. The rooms have all usual facilities, and the restaurant downstairs is quite reasonable. The staff are quite friendly. The hotel is around 15 minutes walk away from the centre of Old Montreal, which is nice. We did not find Montreal to be too safe, and used cabs as often as possible. There is a police station near the hotel. There are lots of places to eat near the hotel, including a nice chinese buffet which was very reasonable. All in all, this hotel is ok, but if you can, definatley stretch to stay somewhere nearer to old montreal and a bit more upmarket!

Reviews.Title: “The room reeked of urine”
Reviews.Author: nwinva
Reviews.Content: After a long drive to Montreal from Virginia, we were relieved finally to pull up at this hotel. We were looking forward to a restful comfortable night. However, upon entering the room, our nostrils were assaulted with the smell of stale urine emanating from the bathroom. It was so putrid that it made us retch when standing in the bathroom. The furniture in the room was damaged as were the walls, and the carpet was so old and filthy that neither of us dared walk on it in bare feet. The staff were friendly and helpful, although our premature departure elicited no question, and it appears to be something they are used to.

Reviews.Title: “Good location terrible beds and pillows.”
Reviews.Author: carlossanchezt1968
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights, and they were terrible. We had a queen size bed . The bed is so bad, that the springs in the center are so used that the bed drove us constantly to the center of it, as if it was woing to "swallow" or "pull us" through the center of the bed. Sleepeing on an angled horizon is not nice. But the worst were the pillows. First we had these "balloons" for pillows.They were extremely big, inflated and impossible to use as a pillow. then we found that there weresome smaller ones in the drawers of the furniture of the room. We tried using them and they were a little better but still, too inflated to sleep. We ended doing "pillows" by stuffing the pillow cases with towels. We called the front desk and they replied: thats all we have. So if you decide to go to this hotel bring your own pillow. The room was preety clean and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Someone's hairs in the ice bucket”
Reviews.Author: hwy7dude
Reviews.Content: One of the shabbiest places ive been. we check in, go into the bathroom, find some kind of hairs and dirt in the ice bucket. I pour water in to wash it out... it turns black so I take it down to the front desk to show them, and they say: 'so what?"

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, very professional”
Reviews.Author: MidwestMom27
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very clean, well maintained. Room price was very reasonable. The rooms are a bit on the small side, but still comfortable. Our room had a mini-fridge, which we always appreciate. We ate dinner one night in the hotel restaurant, and they treated us like special guests. There is a business center, which is accessible by a key obtained from the front desk. Although this is not the most convenient way to access a business center, it also keeps unauthorized users and non-guests out. We used the valet parking at a cost of $20 per day. The valets were very helpful and friendly. We were there for two nights, so were in and out several times.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean rooms, good location, sketchy parking spot”
Reviews.Author: lanorvege
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed by friendly and helpful staff. The lobby was pretty nice and looked well kept. We had a double room with a queen bed, not sure if that is among the smallest rooms, but my guess is that it was. Even so the room turned out to be bigger than we expected, with a couch and living room area separated from the bedroom part. The room was way bigger than what you get downtown in Europe at least. We found it pretty close to the Eaton Centre and other shops and restaurants, as well as Old Montreal. However do not leave anything in your car if you park overnight. The hotel offered an outside parking spot and told us to take out the GPS, which we did. The next day the GPS case, charger as well as car registration and insurance papers were gone. So I guess we'll take that out as well next time...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & staff but run down hotel”
Reviews.Author: asm_9
Reviews.Content: Locaton was in the heart downtown, reception staff was very helpful and served with a smile, old property with large rooms. BUT carpets were old and hotel smelly. Mattress was so bad that it was difficult to sleep on without being rolled over to the middle.

Reviews.Title: “Great rate and location”
Reviews.Author: yzazz
Reviews.Content: This hotel saved my vacation! I have a terrible mold allergy and our original destination was moldy as heck. The Days Inn was our savior, with a great rate and an even better location. We put our car in the garage and walked everywhere. Montreal was a great city and the Days Inn was a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “1st time in Montreal (casino trip)”
Reviews.Author: Richtree7
Reviews.Content: Drove up to Montreal with a cousin...some of the drive through a mini snow snow storm. Temps while in Montreal were in the single digits so did not walk around much. Parked the car in the Days Inn underground parking for $18 per night.(wish I had read about the $2 parking near the police station earlier). The room we had on the 5th floor was nice, clean comfortable. Served our needs well. There was a security guard posted on our floor....he said to control any noise problems. We did not experience any noise. No complaints. Ate in the small restaurant for breakfast twice. Eggs, sausage, toast ,coffee was good. The free internet was slow and sometimes could not get on-line. We were in Montreal primarily to visit the casino. The casino is unusual because it is on 5 different floors, though the elevators and escalators make it accommodating.. Even won a fair amount of money. I will return to Montreal and the Days Inn..hopefully in warmer weather.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location but no Bargain”
Reviews.Author: bjguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Days Inn on Rene Levesque and was a great experience. We had some problems with the Internet and bathtub and didn't take long for management to fix it. We found excellent service all over the hotel a rarity these days. The mini suite room was large and quite pleasant. Location is great if not the most charming that is on a large boulevard but close to everything. The only thing we found is that considering price paid was no bargain prices were fair. Still a great hotel for those who want great service and proximity to everything. Restaurant is really nice in terms of decor but food is just average.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Clean, Great location”
Reviews.Author: imanahan
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to see that this 2.5 star Days Inn was so nice! The staff was really nice. They greeted us when we came in, gave us a map, and offered to tell us about some fun things we can do nearby. But we were tired from the drive, so we took the map and went to our room. My boyfriend and I got a large suite for just $85/night, and I believe parking in the garage was $15/day, maybe less. It's a no frills type of place, but the room was clean and spacious, and our king sized bed was absolutely comfortable. On top of the nice rooms, the location is great. There are plenty of places within walking distance, or you can take the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel and the location is pretty good”
Reviews.Author: JPDucks
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the look of the lobby when my wife and I checked-in. After reading other reviews I was a bit worried, especially about the parking situation. We ended up paying an extra $2 a day to park in the same lot as the police station so that we didnâ€™t have to worry about the car. (Thankfully because of other reviews for this hotel I took out rental insurance because our car was hit in Toronto). Other than that, our room was decent and the location wasnâ€™t bad. The hotel is a few blocks away from Old Montreal and very close to a subway stop to take you anywhere else. Overall I was happy with this hotel because of the deal ($79) I got on it per night.

Reviews.Title: “close to all amenities”
Reviews.Author: Ahmali42
Reviews.Content: I just got back from 3 days in Montreal, was my first time there and I tell you I want to move there!. Days Inn is right down the street from Old MOntreal you can;t beat it. I'm glad I chose this hotel for it's location I can't beleive that it was only a 15 min walk. The staff were so friendly, I'm glad that I don't take some of these reveiws to heart I would not end up going anywhere. I don't speak french but ppl in the city and the hotel were more than accomodating. The staff in the resturant were so friendly room service was prompt. Food delicious. I had the room that has the sofa. I didn't need it but for the same amount of money it gave me space to move around. It has a fridge so I was able to store drinks and yogurts for my morning routine. It was inexpensive, freed up my bank account for other things lol..(shopping) All in all I will go back. If you want bells and whistles, frou frou, than go to the Ritz if youwant a place to hang your hat and rest your head and be close to Old Montreal this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Visit of physicians congress”
Reviews.Author: LubomirD
Reviews.Content: Good situation by chinatown and old french town, near from downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at a Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: djangobibby
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Days Inn on Rene Levesque and better than the first. The staff were professional and the room quite clean. This hotel is well situated, being very close to the winding streets and museums of Old Montreal. It is also close to St. Denis/UQAM/Latin Quartier and is just a ten minute walk, give or take, from the Museum of Contemporary Art and shopping areas on St. Catherine. If you want a very busy tourist area to be right at your doorstep, choose another hotel, but if you don't mind a brief walk in this beautiful, very walkable city and you want to save money, this is a great place to stay. The restaurant attached is pretty good and all of the staff, both in the hotel and the resto were friendly and helpful. We will stay here again, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay but location isn't the best”
Reviews.Author: Habscouple
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Days Inn Montreal while visiting the city to watch a couple of Habs games. It was our first time in the city so we didn' t know what to expect in terms of getting around the city. We knew the hotel was a fair distance from the Bell Centre/downtown but booked anyway mostly due to price. The hotel was clean and staff friendly upon arrival and throughout our stay. They assisted us with questions regarding directions and local sights. The rooms were average, nothing spectacular but we had stayed in a few Days Inn's over the years and didn't expect luxury. Rooms weren't noisy and elevators were good. The hotel is located about a 10 minute walk from the Metro, which will quickly take you to the Bell Centre and downtown shopping. We found there were also lots of taxi's as well. Old Montreal was about a 15-20 minute walk and China Town was about 5 minutes. Lots to see and do in both places. Biggest drawback is the location, with limited restaurants close by. We walked from the metro after games to the hotel and felt safe. Restaurant in lobby was good and we ordered room service as well which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Essence of Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Kirlygirl
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews for hotels because they all seem the same to me. Some are more grand than others, but the service is always the same old plastic experience. This Days Inn deserves praise not because it's building is unique, nor does it have any more amenities than others, it was cleaner than other hotels I've stayed at, the decor in better taste and the little restaurant/bar had a lovely little outdoor sidewalk terrace, but I still wouldn't have taken the time to write about it. I'm writing about this one because of the people inside her that made my visit to Montreal extraordinary. The Days Inn Downtown Montreal is in a great location with easy access to everything, very clean, with pleasant decor, exceptional service, at an affordable price â€“ and that's just in the lobby. On this short trip, I made no reservation and just spontaneously left home for Montreal with my 2 teenagers. Check-in was unusually efficient and we quickly found ourselves in a pleasant room. The day after I arrived, an unforeseen personal problem came up and didnâ€™t know where to turn for help. Now, Iâ€™m no stranger to hotels. Iâ€™ve traveled throughout the US, Canada and Europe. I was a Hotel Admin major in college. Iâ€™ve worked in small and very large hotels, I know what they normally will and will not do for a guest. I imagined the manager here to be just another corporate suit like all others with a smile and a policy reason not to deviate from the normal, but I was very wrong. Through my little crisis, I discovered Oliver Michaud - Directeur de la Reception of the Days Inn. It was not his responsibility to help me. It was entirely my problem. Regardless, he went far out of his way to help me find an intelligent solution and to ensure that our trip to Montreal was comfortable, stress-free and thoroughly enjoyable. Frankly, I was shocked. I didnâ€™t think this caliber of hotel service still existed anywhere! Additionally, the efficiency of the front desk staff (thanks Simon), the non-intrusive housekeeping staff, the delicious food and friendly service from the team at the attached Allegro Restaurant (thanks Jeff and Joyce), and Mr. Ip (the hotel owner)â€“ all helped to make our visit to Montreal go from being a potential disaster to one of the most enjoyable. Iâ€™m so lucky! I got a quick 2 day vacation this year and I happened to randomly wander into the caring arms of a hotel whose people made me feel Iâ€™d found good friends, rather than just visited another chain hotel somewhere in the world. What a pleasant surprise! TIME: 2 days HOTEL: The Days Inn lobby was very clean, and decor very well chosen in good taste. Check-in was quick and easy with an efficient and friendly staff. The indoor parking was full, so like other Trip Advisor reviewers, I too had to park behind the hotel at the cost of $12 CAN â€“ much less expensive than other hotels/cities (Boston - $35 USD per night). The parking lot is shared with the police department next door, but even so, when in a big city itâ€™s common sense to remove valuables from your car. Donâ€™t be stupid. Our room (618) was clean, 2 Q beds- no bed bugs (found even in the best of hotels in New York or Boston), and again nicely chosen fabric dÃ©cor, tv, small fridge, desk with a chair, free wireless internet (ask the front desk for the smtp info), phone â€“ I think they still charge $1.5 for outside calls from the room, but there are 2 pay phones in the lobby near the elevators, a small comfy chair, a really nice iron, a view of the rue Hotel de-Ville - including the sunset off to the right and of course a clean bathroom en suite with perfect water presssure and waterpik showerhead. The room was smallish, but not uncomfortably small. Unfortunately the windows don't open to get some fresh air (yes, the air in Montreal is fresh), but the air conditioner did a very good job at keeping the air fresh and the temperature comfortable. There is no smoking in the hotel, but you can enjoy some coffee or a cocktail with (or without) a cigarette on the Allegroâ€™s open-air terrace, and since the hotel is relatively compact, getting outside is quick and easy with no reason to stink up the room you're going to sleep in with a stale cigarette smell. In fact, it was something I noticed immediately upon entering my room - that it didn't smell hotel-ish or like cigarettes or anything at all. It just smelled clean and nice. RESTAURANT: The next morning we had a delicious breakfast of eggs, fruit, crepes and the always tasty bacon on the open-air terrace of Allegro which is within/attached to the hotel. They also offer a breakfast buffet in the hotel for under $10 CAN but we wanted to eat outside. At Allegro & Days Inn they keep the sidewalk and street area clean, and the little tables & chairs make a very pleasant place to sit and eat while watching people go by on foot, on bicycles, scooters and cars. Jeff and Joyce attended to us, and both offered very pleasant service, making sure that our experience was enjoyable with no pressure at all. Allegro serves all meals and cocktails so I imagine it would have been nice to sit and enjoy an evening cocktail on the terrace as well, but I didn't make the time to do so. LOCATION: This Days Inn sits on the corner of boulevard RenÃ©-LÃ©vesque Est and rue HÃ´tel-de-ville. It has easy access to many places I'm sure, but I only went to 2 places as noted below due to time constraints. I saw no unsavory activity and felt safe to walk everywhere in the area with my children. Old Town (Vieux Montreal): From the inn's front door you can walk directly across the rue (road) Rene-Levesque onto the rue Hotel de-Ville and it is a 5 minute, safe, beeline walk down to the Old Town Montreal (Vieux Montreal). Rue Hotel de-Ville leads directly up to the steps of City Hall - which sports some lovely architecture and a pleasant fountain at the top plaza area, then directly across the street is Jacques Cartier Pl at the center of all the old town with all it's artists, unique shops and restaurants. Explore. Vieux Montreal is charming. I would urge you to walk across the rue de Commune and onto the promenade too. There is a lovely view of the city from the park at night. You really can't go wrong by visiting this section of Montreal. Chinatown: If you walk out the front door of the Days Inn and take a right across the rue Hotel-de-Ville you are only 1 street away from the Chinatown area which looked interesting but didn't get to explore it or any other locations due to time constraints. Traffic was very moderate and the streets well marked, so with a map of the area and a little advice from Simon and Oliver at the front desk, we got around very easily. There is also a bus stop right outside the front door for easy access to everywhere in the beautiful city of Montreal. FRENCH: Donâ€™t be intimidated. All the rumors about ill-tempered French-speaking people in Quebec, are not true in Montreal. Everyone, and I mean EVERYONE we met in Montreal who spoke French as their first language were exceedingly kind about speaking in English to help a stranger with their smiles and hearts sincere. People create the essence of any community regardless of lovely architecture and historic importance. Montreal is interesting and pretty to look at, but it is the people of Montreal that make her so stunningly beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: mbellny
Reviews.Content: Average hotel in a good location for touring Montreal. No continental breakfast. Rooms are small but clean. Nothing special here but a good base for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: ngachacha
Reviews.Content: Great value! Got the Queen Superior suite, comes with one queen sized bed and tv, a living room with couch and chair and a tv, has a mini-fridge and microwave, wireless internet in the room, no breakfast, clean bathroom all for $112! This hotel is located close to downtown Montreal, underground parking or outdoor parking (be careful, the outdoor lot gets full at night and you will get a ticket if you don't park in the desginated area...although the hotel will take care of the ticket for you) Great service, look for Eric the supervisor, he was always willing to provide me with detailed instructions to Montreal attractions, he also recommended a great restaurant down the street. Great service and definitely great value, just mention that you're a CAA member and you should be able to get a discount. House keeping was good.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: Skylarks
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed for one night at this hotel while visiting Montreal during the Jazz Festival. It was conveniently located, within 10 minutes walk of downtown where all the shops, restaurants and jazz festival shows were. The hotel was flexible with check-in times (initially we requested an earlier check-in than 4pm, but called to say we would arrive late). We arrived very late at night and the receptionist was kind enough to extend our check-out time to 1pm (instead of 12pm) the next day. Our short visit meant we didn't get a chance to check out the facilities of the hotel, but the room was very spacious, comfortable and quiet, with a clean bathroom. We were able to leave luggage at the hotel while we saw the city the next day. I would stay here again - very good for a 2 star hotel, and cheap and spacious compared to what I am used to in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Barely adequate accomadations”
Reviews.Author: mupawa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a bachelor party weekend. We got a very good price thanks to some vouchers we got at a travel site for referals. Without the vouchers the rooms were around $110/nt. Parking was cheap: $12 for outdoor/$16 for indoor. There is an onsite restaruant that serves a good cheap breakfast and has outdoor seating on a tiny patio. Location was excellent for our needs which was bar hopping and girlwatching. The rooms were quite small but otherwise standard. Our shower was dirty - pubes in there. Gave it a rinse and used it anyway but I know the more squemesh may have gone ballistic. Beds were adequate, bedding was adequate, though of course seeing pubes makes you wonder if they are really clean. Plastic cups instead of glasses. Air conditioniing was vey loud. View was a white brick wall. Ask for an even numbered room. Very basic accomadation but fine for a weekend of drinking with the boys. I wouldn't go there for a romantic getaway or with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Chafman
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Hotel Place d'Armes but I decided to save $75 and booked one night at the Days Inn. I arrived with my wife around 4:30 PM and had hard times finding a spot to park my car while I checked in as the hotel is on a busy street (Rene Levesque). I had to wait a good 10 minutes before anyone acknowledged my presence although I was the only client. I showed my Expedia reservations and was handed over the keys and shown the direction to the elevator, without being offered any assistance with the luggage which were still in the double-parked car with the flashers on. When I asked for Parking, they charged me $22 and directed me to an external public parking which was 4 blocks away... and still no mention of any assistance with my luggage although there was a blizzard outside. I parked the car on a plaque of ice as it was the only spot available, walked back to the hotel and helped myself with the luggage. When I came back late at night, it took me 45 minutes to park my car as the parking was full and the only alternative was to park in another spot which was reserved for the police station... at least the car was safe. I will refrain from criticizing the room cleanliness, comfort of bed, noise, etc... as it's consistent with the low price I paid. However, I will never go to this hotel again as I have never imagined to be so poorly serviced.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for a very very basic hotel, go here”
Reviews.Author: sjcan8119
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine if you are looking for something to sleep in and nothing more. The rooms are dated and service is uneventful. With all of the wonderful hotels in Montreal that you could choose from, I would suggest paying a bit more and staying somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Travelers Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Euroeast
Reviews.Content: When me and my family arrived on a Friday for a 7 day visit to Montreal the location was perfect. Then the nightmares started. The first night the whole 3rd floor where they placed us was full of Partying young folks. Screaming, Slamming Doors, Crying, Boy friend, Girl friend fights up until 2 a.m. after neumerous calls complaining to the front Desk. We thought it was resolved, but the second night the same thing. No resolution. Well, Sunday they all departed. We thought the end of our troubles. But no the last two nights after returning from site seeing to our suprise our room was never cleaned. The Cleaning Staff had left, and the only thing the Hotel could do is replace towels. No resolution was ever made except for 4 drink vouchures for me, my wife and children. We were never offered to move to another floor or adjust our bill. We sent an e mail to Days Inn Headquarters only to be refered back to the Management of the hotel which again made excuses with no action. I guess Corporate Headquarters Days Inn cannot be bothered with customer service Issues Directly. The only thing good I can say about that hotel it has a Great Restaurant, with Great food.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nice room”
Reviews.Author: laurameee26
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for three nights during April. The room was fine for our needs, although we had some trouble with our key cards. They did not work for a while, and we had to be let in with a key a couple of times. Even after our key cards starting working, it took a few attempts at putting the card in the slot to get in. The room was fine, comfy beds, good bathroom, but the only problem was the room was pretty dark, we needed lights on even in the middle of the day, and the lights themselves wern't particularly bright. But that was our only problem. The hotel was a short walk from the metro station, and had a nice restaurant next door which sold breakfast lunch and dinner. We ate in there a few times and it was very nice. The area around the hotel wasnt too great at night, we felt a bit uncomfortable, but I think this was the same in quite a lot of areas around Montreal. But the hotel is great for a low budget stay, its good value for money, and has free wireless internet which was a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory stay”
Reviews.Author: psalm121
Reviews.Content: I had to travel to Montreal and needed an inexpensive but decent place to stay, that was also close to a certain place. I booked the Days Inn, mostly because of the location and Wyndham Rewards points. The staff for the most part were friendly, and the rooms were average. If you don't speak French you may have a little trouble, as the phone books are all in French, and half the TV stations are French. I didn't even know where to go to eat because I don't know my way around. So I stuck to the hotel restaraunt. But, the restaraunt was closed at weird hours and I don't think I ever saw the bar open. I thought the hotel was a bit overpriced for what you got, but then again, it's Montreal and everything is more expensive there. Overall, it was okay.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for what I needed”
Reviews.Author: bratman7
Reviews.Content: I must say I was rather pleased with my stay at the Days Inn Montreal Downtown. The plusses: -GREAT location close to the old city, the Metro, and downtown -the price was right. $99 a night for a multiple night stay in the summer. -the little restaurant adjacent to the lobby was nice, with good food and reasonable pricing. -they sold LaRonde (amusement park) tickets at a good price. -the front desk staff was amazingly helpful during my stay -room was clean The minuses: -room was a bit small.. we had 2 full size beds so there was not much free room, but it was mostly a non issue as we were in Montreal to see the city, not spend time in the room. -the washroom is a traditional washroom design, with everything in one room, unlike most hotels where the sink and mirror are out in the bedroom, which made things slow in the morning for us (I had two teenage girls with me). This said, the plusses way outweigh the negatives. I will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Psyman42
Reviews.Content: Hotel was horrible. The first night we had to park in the outdoor parking lot and I didnt feel comfy with the dark neighborhood and the drunk people walking around. The outdoor lot was shared with 3 other buildings and there was no clear markings on what spots belonged to the hotel. When asking the front desk people, all 3 of them had no clue on which spots I can park in. The next 2 nights we were able to park indoors but space is limited to first come first serve. There is only about 10 spots inside. The room had a nasty odor to it and the walls and floors looked dirty. On the last day, we went to have breakfast outside of hotel and we came back to the room well before the checkout time and we found they already started cleaning the room. The fresh fruit in our fridge was removed and no where to be found!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Convienent Location”
Reviews.Author: jenniewray
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a convienent location, (only a couple of blocks from Old Montreal & Sherbrook Street shopping) however, it's an extremely dodgy neighbourhood. The lobby and guest rooms are outdated but are overall pretty clean. The staff are quite nice. The underground parking smells awful (and so will your car when you leave). I wouldn't stay here again, but it didn't ruin my trip either.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location !!”
Reviews.Author: catmomrusty
Reviews.Content: Excellent location; just over two blocks to Old Town and a few more blocks to ChinaTown. Public bus stops in front of hotel for easy access to downtown. Room was big and clean. No place to sit other than on bed (usually have table and chairs?). Restaurant had good selection and prices. GREAT experience !!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: beachfamilynewyork
Reviews.Content: We stayed Columbus Day Weekend at this hotel. It is a good hotel for a short stay. I think the location is good, within walking distance to Old Montreal, Chinatown, Latin Section and the underground mall. For the price, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: sleephoto
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Days Inn with a group of about 30 people that traveled from Newfoundland to attend the Bodog Battle of the Bands. All of us between the age range of 18-30. The first night there was great, and same with the second night. We celebrated the chance of making it big with the Bodog battle. But the third night, for some reason the hotel management put a group of 12 year olds on a ski trip on a floor with 30 young adults. Then threatened to kick us out if we didn't keep it down. Keep in mind, we were in our hotel rooms on the opposite side of the hotel. So we agreed to keep it down, we weren't hard to get along with - but it made absolutely NO sence why they would do this. 12 year old children and bands celebrating do not mix. The food however was AMAZING. The little restaurant service was above and beyond awesome, and the food was perfectly delicious. For the price we paid, it was worth it. But management needs to re think where they book people on each floor.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: SamanthaOttawa
Reviews.Content: This was my worst experience in a hotel. I decided to choose this hotel because it was cheaper. But it ended up costing me more. We arrived at the hotel and it looked okay but then I went to the washroom and the toilet wouldn't flush so I called the front desk and they sent a maintenance guy. Well he ended up coming 3-4 times and spending the night in our room. The toilet still wouldn't flush, the bathtub would not drain and the air conditionning was not working (and it was a hot night). In the mini fridge we found stuff from the previous people, and found garbabge under the bed. Also, there were bugs. I was sick of staying in this hotel. So I called a friend and he agreed to come pick us up in montreal. So we had to pay 3 hours of gas, and I asked the front desk to not charge my credit card but when I got my credit card statement they charged me MORE than the usual cost of the room. SO now I have to fight to get my money back. BAD experience. NOT recommended AT ALL.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but If you are non smoking, think about it”
Reviews.Author: MartaZanchi
Reviews.Content: Good location, near Sta. Catarina av.. But I had dsome problems with my room I travelled with my husband and my mom. We booked 2 rooms for 4 nights. Upon arrival, we were placed in 2 smoking rooms when we had asked for non smoking. The windows did not open in the room and the smell of smoke was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Money”
Reviews.Author: habsrule12
Reviews.Content: I had been to Montreal a couple of times before but the hotel where I had stayed one before was closed down. My wife and I decided on booking through Tripadvisor at this hotel based on reviews on other travelers and the location of the hotel. It was an overall good experience. We spent little time in the hotel so do not have any complaints. The room was great (we had the king suite) which was more affordable than a lot of regular rooms at other downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend stay!”
Reviews.Author: LahDee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is easy to find and perfect location. It was within walking distance to all the places we wanted to go. Rooms are on the smaller side but not too crowded. Front desk was quick and efficient and friendly. Parking is just across the street and very reasonably priced ($12 for the weekend). Rooms were clean and comfortable. There seemed to be a lot of groups on our floor but once in the room we never heard any noise from other rooms. Overall, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best location but it will do? I guess”
Reviews.Author: SEPTANJT016
Reviews.Content: I'm writing, probably the newest review of the Days Inn Montreal Downtown, that anyone here for the New Year of 2008. I have to say that this place is really decent-- service was excellent, cleanliness was a great plus but there was one problem for me, here. Location. Despite being on a huge throughfare, Rene-Levesque, the location was horrible in terms of being near a Metro station (Champ-De-Mars). Despite what everyone says about being close to Berri-UQAM and Champ-De-mars Metro, the walk down Rene-Levesque is a bit of a hike and to Champ-De-Mars, the walk is a bit sketchy. Mind you, I was walking from Champ-De-Mars to the hotel at arond 6 PM, and I had to turn around to see who was behind me, depsite being from New York City. Don't get me wrong, Montreal is a great place to be in and I absolutely love it but the area around here, is a bit sketchy at best. Overall, Days Inn Montreal is a great place to stay in for the price that I got at 82.80$ a night. So, when I go back, this place is definitely worth going back to.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedForeigner
Reviews.Content: I did all the price research online before leaving for Montreal but I wasn't sure if I needed to stay overnight, so I left it to chance. I walked in, asked for the price I saw on the internet and they gave it to me. it was around 10:30am and they have a room available. Further, it's one of the suites they have facing the front. According to the floor plan, they have 4 of these bigger rooms on each floor. I know the area quite well and knew not to expect too much. I was pleasantly surprised with a comfortable stay. The room and the bathroom were clean. The best thing is that they have wireless internet access throughout the building. I find the location very convenient since walkable to Chinatown (yummy food) and St Catherine (shopping) even on an 18 degree celsius day. My room actually has a sliver of a view of City Hall in Old Montreal. Parking-wise, they have underground parking (not sure how much). There is also a public , outdoor lot right behind the hotel at $12 a day, which you can go in and out of as you wish.

Reviews.Title: “Beware: check-in time is 4 pm”
Reviews.Author: Mart63nyc
Reviews.Content: Location is good, close to Rue Ste. Catherine, historic Montreal and Chinatown. Beds were ok, but the bathroom showed some wear. No safe in the room, but there was an iron, hair dryer, coffee service. Arrived around noon, but their check-in time is 4 pm. We got up that day for a very early flight so we were anxious to take a short nap before we hit the town. Although they told us to check starting at 1pm (which we did every hour), we didn't get a room until 5 mins before 4 pm. It used to be a good deal, but I'll spend a bit more for a nicer hotel (and earlier check-in).

Reviews.Title: “Spend your Days (and nights) OUT of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: pamatini
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I chose this hotel because the location seemed to be good and the price was decent. We booked 2 rooms for 2 nights. Upon arrival, we were placed in 2 small (not adjacent) smoking rooms when we had asked for non smoking. The windows did not open in the room and the smell of smoke was nauseating. We inquired multiple times about switching rooms and told we were going to be called when a room came available. No phone call, no communication whatsoever. The location was just okay for our needs. Not close enough to walk to many of the clubs and bars we were interested in visiting. That was our fault for not choosing our hotel location wisely. The staff was cordial, and the bartender was very nice offereing suggestions and tips on where to go. Still they were unwilling to switch us into a non-smoking room which was annoying. The rooms were also tiny and perhaps because of the smoke just didn't feel 'clean' to me. Overall the hotel wasn't horrible, but there are better options for the same or a little extra money. Skip the Days Inn Downtown and explore another option.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: americantraveler080
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because the price was lower than the very expensive other hotels. The hotel is a 8-story glass tower and has a small restaurant which had good food. Our room was small, clean and basic. The parking garage is nice and safe. The subway station is very close which was great as we were doing a lot of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful and Knowledgable Staff”
Reviews.Author: IshSingh
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through AAA for approx $130 CDN. The rooms were small but comfortable. The hotel only has 8 floors and some of the buildings around it are higher. So forget the good views. The staff is extremely helpful and nice. They gave us excellant suggestions on places to visit and eat. They were great with directions. They have very limited hotel parking. So call ahead to reserve a spot if you will be parking at the hotel. Satisfied with our stay. Enjoy. Ish

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad”
Reviews.Content: Based on price, this hotel is okay. Provided we were there in winter, it is not that convenient as opposed to some hotels near the old montrÃ©al. However staff were very friendly and parking is not overpriced. Rooms are okay, just keep in mind it is a days inn. Would recommend this hotel for summer trips and for people who don't want to spend much on accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, very good location”
Reviews.Author: pavfec
Reviews.Content: I was having day surgery at HÃ´pital St-Luc, so I wanted to find a hotel close by to spend the night before because we were coming from out of town. I booked the room through the hotel website and it went smoothly. The hotel is situation on RenÃ©-LÃ©vesque Blvd. in downtown Montreal. It's 3 blocks from Saint-Denis St., close to the metro, Chinatown and downtown. Check-in was quick and they gave us a parking pass for a public lot a block north of the hotel. Parking was $14.00 for the night, and we were able to extend that for the day for only $5.00. Our room was on the 6th floor and had 2 double beds, bathroom, closet, and a dresser in which the TV was hidden. We were facing a side street, but nevertheless heard the traffic in the morning on RenÃ©-LÃ©vesque. The room was clean and service was very good. I would recommend this to visitors and anyone going to the hospital since it's a 5-minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for a short visit”
Reviews.Author: dcd4evr
Reviews.Content: Although my wife and I were a bit hesitant to book at this hotel because of some of the reviews, we wanted to be able to spend more money in the city than on lodgings so we booked two nights. It was economical, close to both the Old City and the Latin Quarter where we had tickets to a special concert, and easy to find (we are not yet well-acclimated to Montreal). We DID choose to park inside and to upgrade the room to a suite with King bed and microwave due to the safety factor and our own needs. First of all, we found the staff helpful, gracious, prompt and very forthcoming with information and tips on how to enjoy Montreal to its fullest. Second, the hotel truly was amazingly easy to get to from Route 10 (coming from New England) - take 10 to the end in the center of the city, find Boulevard Rene Levesque, take a right, go down 12 blocks and it's right there! Third, walking toward the water gets you to the Old City and the Old Port in about 10 minutes; ditto for the Latin Quarter north and several other advantageous attractions. And finally the rooms! We somehow got a conference room attached to our suite, fine for stretching out and I can imagine conducting a small conference comfortably there. The bed was huge and very comfortable, the bathroom was immaculate and spectacular in every way, air conditioner units kept our rooms exceptionally comfortable and the location of our room, close to but not ON Rene Levesque, allowed for a little traffic noise but not enough to disturb us. The room was one of the refurbished suites and soundproofing and comfort level overall was amazing - and the chambermaid cleaned up the room well into the afternoon for us. For $300CAN total, we were extremely satisfied and will stay there again for every one of the above reasons. The next time, though, we'll be staying for an entire week!

Reviews.Title: “Not TOO bad...”
Reviews.Author: Picouline
Reviews.Content: I just return from this hotel. First, the girl at the reception vas very nice and the lobby was very clean. Even though it was around 6:00 p.m., the hotel's restaurant was empty. Strange... I didn't try it but reading the previous commentaries, I understand why there was no one there... The room was good, relatively clean BUT there was something I couldn't identify almost everywhere, on the furnitures, the tv, even the bed, something really greasy, something like oil, only on some spots. Each time we touched something, we were disgusted. Maybe it was the product used to polish but ... well... If you go there, which is not totally a bad idea if your budget is limited, please ask for a room that is not in front of the boulevard. At around 6:00 in the morning, you'll hear buses, trucks, motors, horns... because there's a lot of traffic ! You can easily walk to many attractions but don't expect a calm, quiet and beautiful street. It is not ! Once you are aware and are ready to accept those conditions, then you won't be diasappointed and your stay can even be good.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for you money!”
Reviews.Author: RobertPPK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Days Inn for just over a week and had a hassle free stay. The staff were lovely and the rooms were decent size. Had a huge bed and all the necessary facilites. Bathrooms were clean. Only problem I had was there was no wireless access in the hotel room, so I had to go down to the lobby to use internet. Location was good about 7 blocks from the Eaton center and close to restuarants and shops. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fair for the Price”
Reviews.Author: dfword
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October, 2006. The hotel wasn't a total disaster; the rooms were clean enough, albeit a bit run-down. The place had a distinct musty odor. The shower and water pressure/hot water was good. The staff was friendly. The wireless internet access worked sometime, sometimes not. The vending machines are a joke (they only take CAD dollar coins). The neighborhood isn't the best, but more non-descript than dangerous. Close to the University and Metro, but pretty far away (a mile) from shopping; the hotel parallels the seediest stretch of St. Catherine Street. Some bums, drunks, and of homeless folks around, but nobody that would rob you. If you are on a tight budget, this is probably the the cheapest "brand name" downtown hotel. Just don't expect great things.

Reviews.Title: “food!!”
Reviews.Author: leodamus
Reviews.Content: absolutely awful.... Do not eat in the little dining area on the ground floor, it's the worst kind of bland, microwaved rubbish I've ever eaten. No matter how cheap or easy it seems, avoid it. Take a walk instead. Sadly we were so tired after arriving from the UK that we coul'nt be bothered to go out. Conversely, breakfast was good. Room was fine, staff most helpful. Location made getting down on foot to the old port easy. Just be aware that there are a fair number of (basically harmless) down & outs in the area and that some of them use parts of the nearest Metro station (champ-de-mars) as a living area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, surrounded by thieves”
Reviews.Author: vgg2
Reviews.Content: The hotel experience had been good during our first day/night in Canada, until my backpack was robbed from the backseat of the rental car. Was loading baggage on a beautiful Sunday morning, parked along the curb right in front of the Montreal Downtown Days Inn reception desk, when approached by a well-dressed middle aged gentleman with a foreign-sounding accent, waving a street map and asking directions. While he distracted me his accomplice opened the car and took off with a backpack with my Dutch passport, keys, travel info, etc. While reporting the incident at the police station, conveniently located on the same block, another American hotel guest came to report his truck was stolen from the exterior parking lot used by the hotel (hotel has only limited indoor parking). While reporting the incident to the hotel reception desk a third American guest reported his van had been broken into overnight in the same lot. The hotel is conveniently located, but is at the edge of a rather seedy neighbourhood, and apparently requires some cleaning up. Needless to say this spoiled much of the high expectations we had for our first Canadian vacation. Two weeks later, back home, trying to figure out how to retrieve my car from airport parking without keys, and with a trip to the consulate for a new passport on tomorrow's agenda, I would like say thanks for nothing to the lowlifes in Montreal. Han van Gorsel, Houston, Tx, USA

Reviews.Title: “Good quality, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: JannieR
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the beginning of June. A well-run hotel with friendly and informative staff. We were able to park outside the hotel while we unloaded our luggage. The hotel offered parking for $10.00/night in an adjacent parking lot (we could see our car from the hotel room). The reception staff were very welcoming and friendly. The reception area was modern and trendy and furnished with armchairs and sofas on marble flooring. The hotel was located on Rene-Levesque Blvd East within walking distance of the downtown area, Ste-Catherine St, Old Montreal, the Old Port, Chinatown & the Quartier Latin. We had dinner in the hotel restaurant, Cafe Allegro,on our first evening served by a very friendly and overworked waiter who was very accommodating (even offered to go home to get icecream from his freezer, as there was none on the menu!) The meal was tasty and good value in ambient surroundings. We subsequently bought our breakfasts in the hotel restaurant as it was convenient and tasty. Our average sized room had 2 very comfortable double beds and plenty of luggage storage. There was a small window that looked out to the side of the building towards downtown and the port area. The room was rather dark, and we needed the light on most of the time. The furnishings and decor were reasonably contemporary, and all very clean. There was air-conditioning, coffee-maker, safe, free newspaper, free internet access, iron/board, TV, Radio/alarm, hairdrier, decent toiletries. The bathroom was of a good size with good water pressure and adequate towels. We did have a bit of a problem on leaving. When I paid the bill I had worked out the approximate price for extras such as parking, tax and meals, but the bill came to about $40.00 more than expected. When I queried this I was told it was all tax - "in Canada you pay tax on tax" I was told, but I knew that my restaurant bills had already included all the tax and tips.
